usa: Ludlow massacre: The camps of striking coal miners were attacked by the Colorado National Guard; killing 25, including 11 children.[60]
World War I: Austria-Hungary invaded the Kingdom of Serbia after the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand; triggering the start of World War I.[61]
The first Mother's Day was observed.<sup id="cite_ref-62" class="reference">[62]</sup>
The Federal Trade Commission was established.<sup id="cite_ref-63" class="reference">[63]</sup>
The Clayton Antitrust Act was signed into law.<sup id="cite_ref-64" class="reference">[64]</sup>
